dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That is a staggering amount of time, and this latest one, their hundredth investigation, uh, focuses on Mikhail Lomtadze, a former janitor who somehow ended up running a digital company into the ground.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA

HostA: And then you have the lead investigator, a Mr. Boris, calling him entirely incompetent. That's pretty direct.
HostB: But then from his prison cell in Siberia, Lomtadze claims he never even participated in a survey, says the whole thing is fabricated.
HostA: Which is wild, because he also says he knows nothing about digital technology or any customers, which kinda proves their point, doesn't it?
HostB: It really does. I mean, if you're running a tech company, that's not a great thing to admit, even from a Siberian prison.
HostA: And the report includes an analysis of his crimes and even an autopsy report? He's dead?
HostB: Apparently so, yeah. The whole thing is just a bizarre and tragic story from start to finish.
